name: Walfredo Reyes Jr.
description:
'''Walfredo Reyes Jr.''' (born '''Walfredo de los Reyes Palau IV'''; December 18, 1955) is a [[Cuban American]] musician who is an expert in [[drum set]] and [[Percussion section#Auxiliary percussion|auxiliary percussion]], and a [[Music education|music educator]] and [[clinic (music)|clinician]]. He has performed with many [[jazz]], [[Latin American music|Latin]], [[World music]], [[World fusion#World fusion|World fusion]], [[Music of Cuba#African heritage|Afro-Cuban]], and [[Rock band#Rock and pop bands|rock]] bands as a [[Concert tour#Concert tour|touring]], [[Session musician|session recording]], and full-time player/performer.

Reyes is known for his fusion of many of the world's percussion techniques, including the ability to play a drum set with his hands in addition to the traditional use of drumsticks; it was said that he can "sound like a drummer and a percussionist at the same time" He was a member of [[Santana (band)|Santana]] and joined [[Chicago (band)|Chicago]] as the percussionist from 2012 to 2018, at which point he took over the drum seat. He also performed in the band of former [[Nazareth (band)|Nazareth]] guitarist [[Manny Charlton]]. Reyes is the title character of the [[Phish]] song "Walfredo".
